contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=June 2009}} {{Politics of São Tomé and Príncipe}} '''Uê Kédadji''' is an electoral coalition in [[São Tomé and Príncipe]]. ==Member parties== *[[Democratic Renovation Party (São Tomé)|Democratic Renovation Party]] *[[National Union for Democracy and Progress (São Tomé)|National Union for Democracy and Progress]] *[[Opposition Democratic Coalition]] *[[People's Party of Progress]] *[[Social Renewal Party (São Tomé)|Social Renewal Party]] – joined in early 2006. The [[Independent Democratic Action]] (ADI) party, which was part of the coalition in the 2002 election, left and decided to contest the 2006 election independently. ==2002 election== In the [[São Tomé and Príncipe legislative election, 2002|legislative election]] held on 3 March 2002, Uê Kédadji won 16.2% of the vote and 8 of 55 seats in the [[National Assembly of São Tomé and Príncipe|National Assembly]].{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}} ==2006 election== In the [[São Tomé and Príncipe legislative election, 2006|legislative election]] held on 26 March 2006, the coalition failed to win any seats in the National Assembly. [[Category:Political parties in São Tomé and Príncipe]] {{Africa-party-stub}} {{SaoTomePrincipe-stub}}
